TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SByteConverter extends System.ComponentModel.BaseNumberConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert 8-bit unsigned integer objects to and from a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can convert only an 8-bit unsigned integer object to and from a string.
The <xref:System.SByte> value type represents integers with values ranging from negative 128 to positive 127. This data type is not supported in Visual Basic.
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of <xref:System.ComponentModel.SByteConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
## Examples The following sample converts a variable of type <xref:System.SByte> to a string, and vice versa.
[!code-cpp[Converters#18](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CPP/converters.cpp#18)] [!code-csharp[Converters#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CS/converters.cs#18)] [!code-vb[Converters#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/VB/converters.vb#18)]
